p.s: In the following, I will discuss the subject why it is difficult for Whites and Hispanics to live together in California and will give a suggestion how the situation could be improved.
In order to do that we need to have a look at the situation in California.
California is a state whithwith a lot of immigrants.
A lot of legal immigrants who work there.
In addition o that, people who are born there but their family the generation before them has other roots.
A lot of them are europeanEuropean.
Jack Jardine in the novel portrays an example of that.
Moreover, there are immigrants who once immigrated illegally and became citizens over time after going through a long process.
This process of gaining citizenship can take five years or longer.
Can you imagine that?
In addition to this, the tests you have to take are really hard and contain topics and questions Americans could not even answer themselves.
So, the process is hard.
That is why the percentage of illegal immigrants in California is rather high.
A lot of these illegal immigrants are Hispanic because California is located right next to Latin America, at the border to Mexico.
It's rather easy immigrating to California that way.
That is how Cándid and Ámerica came to the US.
You should think that with the high rate of immigrants in the state you would be used to it and it wouldn't be a problem at all.
Sadly though, apparently it is not that easy for a lot of people there.
A lot of Americans are full of prejudices in this aspect.
They claim that Hispanics are criminals and often treat them this way.
The gate discussion in the novel is a clear example for that.
They want to shut themselves of.
Avoid Mexicans and the things that supposably come with them.
Of course, most Americans don't admit it that openly.
They act out of indirect racism.
Because of that attitude, which is totally ironic by the way because California used to belong to Latin America.
However, this attitude, makes it really hard for Hispanics, especially illegal immigrants to live with them peacefully.
I am sure they want to and wish for that but the reality looks different.
Sadly.
They want to be included, they want to do their part by working for example.
Although even that doesn't work that easily.
Employers will probably alwys prefer a legal, American worker over aan immigrant with no paper, no matter how desperate they are.
Which is also understandable.
Illegal work is also forbidden in Germany.
To conclude, in order to improve this situation, the process of being able to work legally has to get easier.

Moreover, Americans who are not tolerant yet need to change their attitude and should try to be more over and not let themselves be leadedlead by prejudices, even though it can be hard for everyone to act completely without prejudices.
